get.description: List the installed extensions in the account / project collection.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: includeDisabledExtensions
parameters.description: If true (the default), include disabled extensions in the results.

parameters.name: includeErrors
parameters.description: If true, include installed extensions with errors.

parameters.name: assetTypes
parameters.description: Determines which files are returned in the files array.  Provide the wildcard '*' to return all files, or a colon separated list to retrieve files with specific asset types.

patch.description: Update an installed extension. Typically this API is used to enable or disable an extension.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

get.description: Get an installed extension by its publisher and extension name.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: assetTypes
parameters.description: Determines which files are returned in the files array.  Provide the wildcard '*' to return all files, or a colon separated list to retrieve files with specific asset types.

delete.description: Uninstall the specified extension from the account / project collection.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

post.description: Install the specified extension into the account / project collection.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

operationState.description: State of the AcquisitionOperation for the current user

values.description: Not allowed to use this AcquisitionOperation
Allowed to use this AcquisitionOperation
Operation has already been completed and is no longer available
Not yet used
Install this extension into the host provided
Buy licenses for this extension and install into the host provided
Try this extension
Request this extension for installation
No action found
Request admins for purchasing extension

reason.description: Optional reason to justify current state. Typically used with Disallow state.

reasons.description: List of reasons indicating why the operation is not allowed.

message.description: User-friendly message clarifying the reason for disallowance

type.description: Type of reason for disallowance - AlreadyInstalled, UnresolvedDemand, etc.

AcquisitionOptions.description: Market item acquisition options (install, buy, etc) for an installation target.

defaultOperation.description: Default Operation for the ItemId in this target

itemId.description: The item id that this options refer to

operations.description: Operations allowed for the ItemId in this target

properties.description: Additional properties which can be added to the request.

target.description: The target that this options refer to

ClientContribution.description: Representation of a ContributionNode that can be used for serialized to clients.

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the contribution/type

includes.description: Includes is a set of contributions that should have this contribution included in their targets list.

targets.description: The ids of the contribution(s) that this contribution targets. (parent contributions)

ClientContributionNode.description: Representation of a ContributionNode that can be used for serialized to clients.

children.description: List of ids for contributions which are children to the current contribution.

parents.description: List of ids for contributions which are parents to the current contribution.

name.description: Unique identifier for this provider. The provider name can be used to cache the contribution data and refer back to it when looking for changes

version.description: Version of contributions associated with this contribution provider.

ClientDataProviderQuery.description: A client data provider are the details needed to make the data provider request from the client.

queryServiceInstanceType.description: The Id of the service instance type that should be communicated with in order to resolve the data providers from the client given the query values.

Contribution.description: An individual contribution made by an extension

constraints.description: List of constraints (filters) that should be applied to the availability of this contribution

includes.description: Includes is a set of contributions that should have this contribution included in their targets list.

restrictedTo.description: List of demanded claims in order for the user to see this contribution (like anonymous, public, member...).

targets.description: The ids of the contribution(s) that this contribution targets. (parent contributions)

ContributionBase.description: Base class shared by contributions and contribution types

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the contribution/type

visibleTo.description: VisibleTo can be used to restrict whom can reference a given contribution/type. This value should be a list of publishers or extensions access is restricted too.  Examples: "ms" - Means only the "ms" publisher can reference this. "ms.vss-web" - Means only the "vss-web" extension from the "ms" publisher can reference this.

ContributionConstraint.description: Specifies a constraint that can be used to dynamically include/exclude a given contribution

group.description: An optional property that can be specified to group constraints together. All constraints within a group are AND'd together (all must be evaluate to True in order for the contribution to be included). Different groups of constraints are OR'd (only one group needs to evaluate to True for the contribution to be included).

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of a shared constraint

inverse.description: If true, negate the result of the filter (include the contribution if the applied filter returns false instead of true)

properties.description: Properties that are fed to the contribution filter class

relationships.description: Constraints can be optionally be applied to one or more of the relationships defined in the contribution. If no relationships are defined then all relationships are associated with the constraint. This means the default behaviour will eliminate the contribution from the tree completely if the constraint is applied.

ContributionNodeQuery.description: A query that can be issued for contribution nodes

contributionIds.description: The contribution ids of the nodes to find.

dataProviderContext.description: Contextual information that can be leveraged by contribution constraints

includeProviderDetails.description: Indicator if contribution provider details should be included in the result.

queryOptions.description: Query options tpo be used when fetching ContributionNodes

values.description: Include the direct contributions that have the ids queried.
Include the contributions that directly target the contributions queried.
Include the contributions from the entire sub-tree targeting the contributions queried.
Include the contribution being queried as well as all contributions that target them recursively.
Some callers may want the entire tree back without constraint evaluation being performed.

ContributionNodeQueryResult.description: Result of a contribution node query.  Wraps the resulting contribution nodes and provider details.

nodes.description: Map of contribution ids to corresponding node.

providerDetails.description: Map of provider ids to the corresponding provider details object.

ContributionPropertyDescription.description: Description about a property of a contribution type

required.description: True if this property is required

type.description: The type of value used for this property

values.description: Contribution type is unknown (value may be anything)
Value is a string
Value is a Uri
Value is a GUID
Value is True or False
Value is an integer
Value is a double
Value is a DateTime object
Value is a generic Dictionary/JObject/property bag
Value is an array
Value is an arbitrary/custom object

name.description: Unique identifier for this provider. The provider name can be used to cache the contribution data and refer back to it when looking for changes

version.description: Version of contributions associated with this contribution provider.

ContributionType.description: A contribution type, given by a json schema

indexed.description: Controls whether or not contributions of this type have the type indexed for queries. This allows clients to find all extensions that have a contribution of this type.  NOTE: Only TrustedPartners are allowed to specify indexed contribution types.

properties.description: Describes the allowed properties for this contribution type

DataProviderContext.description: Contextual information that data providers can examine when populating their data

properties.description: Generic property bag that contains context-specific properties that data providers can use when populating their data dictionary

exceptionType.description: The type of the exception that was thrown.

message.description: Message that is associated with the exception.

stackTrace.description: The StackTrace from the exception turned into a string.

DataProviderQuery.description: A query that can be issued for data provider data

context.description: Contextual information to pass to the data providers

contributionIds.description: The contribution ids of the data providers to resolve

DataProviderResult.description: Result structure from calls to GetDataProviderData

clientProviders.description: This is the set of data providers that were requested, but either they were defined as client providers, or as remote providers that failed and may be retried by the client.

data.description: Property bag of data keyed off of the data provider contribution id

exceptions.description: Set of exceptions that occurred resolving the data providers.

resolvedProviders.description: List of data providers resolved in the data-provider query

scopeName.description: Scope name applied to this data provider result.

scopeValue.description: Scope value applied to this data provider result.

sharedData.description: Property bag of shared data that was contributed to by any of the individual data providers

DataProviderSharedData.description: Data bag that any data provider can contribute to. This shared dictionary is returned in the data provider result.

ExtensionAcquisitionRequest.description: Contract for handling the extension acquisition process

assignmentType.description: How the item is being assigned

values.description: Just assign for me
Assign for all users in the account

billingId.description: The id of the subscription used for purchase

itemId.description: The marketplace id (publisherName.extensionName) for the item

operationType.description: The type of operation, such as install, request, purchase

values.description: Not yet used
Install this extension into the host provided
Buy licenses for this extension and install into the host provided
Try this extension
Request this extension for installation
No action found
Request admins for purchasing extension

properties.description: Additional properties which can be added to the request.

quantity.description: How many licenses should be purchased

extensionName.description: Extension that the change was made for

publisherName.description: Publisher that the extension is part of

ExtensionAuditLogEntry.description: An audit log entry for an extension

auditAction.description: Change that was made to extension

auditDate.description: Date at which the change was made

updatedBy.description: Represents the user who made the change

ExtensionDataCollection.description: Represents a single collection for extension data documents

documents.description: A list of documents belonging to the collection

scopeType.description: The type of the collection's scope, such as Default or User

scopeValue.description: The value of the collection's scope, such as Current or Me

ExtensionDataCollectionQuery.description: Represents a query to receive a set of extension data collections

collections.description: A list of collections to query

extension.description: The extension which has been updated

extensionVersion.description: The current version of the extension that was updated

host.description: Name of the collection for which the extension was requested

modifiedBy.description: Represents the user who initiated the update

updateType.description: The type of update that was made

ExtensionEventCallback.description: Base class for an event callback for an extension

uri.description: The uri of the endpoint that is hit when an event occurs

ExtensionEventCallbackCollection.description: Collection of event callbacks - endpoints called when particular extension events occur.

postDisable.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension disable has occurred.

postEnable.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension enable has occurred.

postInstall.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension install has completed.

postUninstall.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension uninstall has occurred.

postUpdate.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension update has occurred.

preInstall.description: Optional.  Defines an endpoint that gets called via a POST request to notify that an extension install is about to occur.  Response indicates whether to proceed or abort.

versionCheck.description: For multi-version extensions, defines an endpoint that gets called via an OPTIONS request to determine the particular version of the extension to be used

manageExtensionsPage.description: Url of the extension management page

ExtensionIdentifier.description: Represents the component pieces of an extensions fully qualified name, along with the fully qualified name.

extensionName.description: The ExtensionName component part of the fully qualified ExtensionIdentifier

publisherName.description: The PublisherName component part of the fully qualified ExtensionIdentifier

ExtensionLicensing.description: How an extension should handle including contributions based on licensing

overrides.description: A list of contributions which deviate from the default licensing behavior

ExtensionManifest.description: Base class for extension properties which are shared by the extension manifest and the extension model

baseUri.description: Uri used as base for other relative uri's defined in extension

constraints.description: List of shared constraints defined by this extension

contributions.description: List of contributions made by this extension

contributionTypes.description: List of contribution types defined by this extension

demands.description: List of explicit demands required by this extension

eventCallbacks.description: Collection of endpoints that get called when particular extension events occur

fallbackBaseUri.description: Secondary location that can be used as base for other relative uri's defined in extension

language.description: Language Culture Name set by the Gallery

licensing.description: How this extension behaves with respect to licensing

manifestVersion.description: Version of the extension manifest format/content

marketplaceBaseUri.description: Marketplace uri used as base for other relative uris defined in extension. Uri might be the same as BaseUri.

restrictedTo.description: Default user claims applied to all contributions (except the ones which have been specified restrictedTo explicitly) to control the visibility of a contribution.

scopes.description: List of all oauth scopes required by this extension

serviceInstanceType.description: The ServiceInstanceType(Guid) of the VSTS service that must be available to an account in order for the extension to be installed

ExtensionPolicy.description: Policy with a set of permissions on extension operations

values.description: No permission
Permission on private extensions
Permission on public extensions
Permission in extensions that are in preview
Permission in released extensions
Permission in 1st party extensions
Mask that defines all permissions
No permission
Permission on private extensions
Permission on public extensions
Permission in extensions that are in preview
Permission in released extensions
Permission in 1st party extensions
Mask that defines all permissions

ExtensionRequest.description: A request for an extension (to be installed or have a license assigned)

rejectMessage.description: Required message supplied if the request is rejected

requestDate.description: Date at which the request was made

requestedBy.description: Represents the user who made the request

requestMessage.description: Optional message supplied by the requester justifying the request

requestState.description: Represents the state of the request

values.description: The request has been opened, but not yet responded to
The request was accepted (extension installed or license assigned)
The request was rejected (extension not installed or license not assigned)

resolveDate.description: Date at which the request was resolved

resolvedBy.description: Represents the user who resolved the request

extension.description: The extension which has been requested

host.description: Information about the host for which this extension is requested

hostName.description: Name of the collection for which the extension was requested

updateType.description: The type of update that was made

extension.description: The extension which has been requested

host.description: Information about the host for which this extension is requested

updateType.description: The type of update that was made

requestPage.description: Link to view the extension request

lastVersionCheck.description: The time at which the version was last checked

extensionPage.description: Link to view the extension details page

values.description: No flags exist for this version.
The Validated flag for a version means the extension version has passed validation and can be used.
The Prerelease flag for a version means the extension version is prerelease. This flag is runtime only.
This version has been deleted.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

InstalledExtension.description: Represents a VSTS extension along with its installation state

extensionId.description: The friendly extension id for this extension - unique for a given publisher.

extensionName.description: The display name of the extension.

files.description: This is the set of files available from the extension.

flags.description: Extension flags relevant to contribution consumers

values.description: A built-in extension is installed for all VSTS accounts by default
The extension comes from a fully-trusted publisher

installState.description: Information about this particular installation of the extension

lastPublished.description: This represents the date/time the extensions was last updated in the gallery. This doesnt mean this version was updated the value represents changes to any and all versions of the extension.

publisherId.description: Unique id of the publisher of this extension

publisherName.description: The display name of the publisher

registrationId.description: Unique id for this extension (the same id is used for all versions of a single extension)

InstalledExtensionState.description: The state of an installed extension

values.description: No flags set
Extension is disabled
Extension is a built in
Extension has multiple versions
Extension is not installed.  This is for builtin extensions only and can not otherwise be set.
Error performing version check
Trusted extensions are ones that are given special capabilities. These tend to come from Microsoft and can't be published by the general public.  Note: BuiltIn extensions are always trusted.
Extension is currently in an error state
Extension scopes have changed and the extension requires re-authorization
Error performing auto-upgrade. For example, if the new version has demands not supported the extension cannot be auto-upgraded.

Extension is currently in a warning state, that can cause a degraded experience. The degraded experience can be caused for example by some installation issues detected such as implicit demands not supported.
Extension is currently unpublished in the marketplace. Extension usage should be reviewed and removed if it is no longer needed

lastUpdated.description: The time at which this installation was last updated

source.description: Source of the installation issue, for example  "Demands"

values.description: Represents an installation warning, for example an implicit demand not supported
Represents an installation error, for example an explicit demand not supported

type.description: Gets the node type for this JToken.

LicensingOverride.description: Maps a contribution to a licensing behavior

behavior.description: How the inclusion of this contribution should change based on licensing

values.description: Default value - only include the contribution if the user is licensed for the extension
Only include the contribution if the user is NOT licensed for the extension
Always include the contribution regardless of whether or not the user is licensed for the extension

id.description: Fully qualified contribution id which we want to define licensing behavior for

values.description: No flags exist for this extension.
The Disabled flag for an extension means the extension can't be changed and won't be used by consumers. The disabled flag is managed by the service and can't be supplied by the Extension Developers.

BuiltIn Extension are available to all Tenants. An explicit registration is not required. This attribute is reserved and can't be supplied by Extension Developers.  BuiltIn extensions are by definition Public. There is no need to set the public flag for extensions marked BuiltIn.

This extension has been validated by the service. The extension meets the requirements specified. This attribute is reserved and can't be supplied by the Extension Developers. Validation is a process that ensures that all contributions are well formed. They meet the requirements defined by the contribution type they are extending. Note this attribute will be updated asynchronously as the extension is validated by the developer of the contribution type. There will be restricted access to the extension while this process is performed.
Trusted extensions are ones that are given special capabilities. These tend to come from Microsoft and can't be published by the general public.  Note: BuiltIn extensions are always trusted.

The Paid flag indicates that the commerce can be enabled for this extension. Publisher needs to setup Offer/Pricing plan in Azure. If Paid flag is set and a corresponding Offer is not available, the extension will automatically be marked as Preview. If the publisher intends to make the extension Paid in the future, it is mandatory to set the Preview flag. This is currently available only for VSTS extensions only.

This extension registration is public, making its visibility open to the public. This means all tenants have the ability to install this extension. Without this flag the extension will be private and will need to be shared with the tenants that can install it.

This extension has multiple versions active at one time and version discovery should be done using the defined "Version Discovery" protocol to determine the version available to a specific user or tenant.  @TODO: Link to Version Discovery Protocol.
The system flag is reserved, and cant be used by publishers.

The Preview flag indicates that the extension is still under preview (not yet of "release" quality). These extensions may be decorated differently in the gallery and may have different policies applied to them.
The Unpublished flag indicates that the extension can't be installed/downloaded. Users who have installed such an extension can continue to use the extension.
The Trial flag indicates that the extension is in Trial version. The flag is right now being used only with respect to Visual Studio extensions.

The Locked flag indicates that extension has been locked from Marketplace. Further updates/acquisitions are not allowed on the extension until this is present. This should be used along with making the extension private/unpublished.
This flag is set for extensions we want to hide from Marketplace home and search pages. This will be used to override the exposure of builtIn flags.
This flag is set for extensions that are marked as deleted. The deleted flag is managed by the service and can't be supplied by the Extension Developers.

presentInConflictList.description: Check if Extension is in conflict list or not. Taking as String and not as boolean because we don't want end customer to see this flag and by making it Boolean it is coming as false for all the cases.

publishedDate.description: Date on which the extension was first uploaded.

releaseDate.description: Date on which the extension first went public.

PublisherFacts.description: High-level information about the publisher, like id's and names

values.description: This should never be returned, it is used to represent a publisher who's flags haven't changed during update calls.
No flags exist for this publisher.

The Disabled flag for a publisher means the publisher can't be changed and won't be used by consumers, this extends to extensions owned by the publisher as well. The disabled flag is managed by the service and can't be supplied by the Extension Developers.

A verified publisher is one that Microsoft has done some review of and ensured the publisher meets a set of requirements. The requirements to become a verified publisher are not listed here.  They can be found in public documentation (TBD).

A Certified publisher is one that is Microsoft verified and in addition meets a set of requirements for its published extensions. The requirements to become a certified publisher are not listed here.  They can be found in public documentation (TBD).
This is the set of flags that can't be supplied by the developer and is managed by the service itself.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

RequestedExtension.description: A request for an extension (to be installed or have a license assigned)

extensionName.description: The unique name of the extension

extensionRequests.description: A list of each request for the extension

publisherDisplayName.description: DisplayName of the publisher that owns the extension being published.

publisherName.description: Represents the Publisher of the requested extension

requestCount.description: The total number of requests for an extension

ResolvedDataProvider.description: Entry for a specific data provider's resulting data

duration.description: The total time the data provider took to resolve its data (in milliseconds)

UserExtensionPolicy.description: Represents the extension policy applied to a given user

displayName.description: User display name that this policy refers to

permissions.description: The extension policy applied to the user

userId.description: User id that this policy refers to

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.extension: Grants the ability to read installed extensions.
scopes.vso.extension_manage: Grants the ability to install, uninstall, and perform other administrative actions on installed extensions.
scopes.vso.extension.data: Grants the ability to read data (settings and documents) stored by installed extensions.
scopes.vso.extension.data_write: Grants the ability to read and write data (settings and documents) stored by installed extensions.
